results.title: Great walls make great art
results.brief_description: Great art is one of the world’s most expensive commodities - well out of the reach of most people. This film considers the multimillion dollar art industry which makes available inexpensive paintings according to public tastes and changing fashions in interior design.

results.title: Herring gull behaviour
results.creator_credit: James G. Schaadt and Education Development Center
results.brief_description: This documentary charts the life of the herring gull, a seabird. Focusing on its life within its natural habitat, the film looks at such things as the behavioural characteristics of the herring gull. These include: feeding habits, mating rituals, breeding habits etc.

results.title: Doris Lessing
results.creator_credit: John Archer and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Well known writer Doris Lessing is interviewed about her life in Africa and the books she has written including “The grass is singing”, “The golden notebook”, “Briefing for a descent into hell”, and “Marriage between Zones 3,4 and 5”.

results.title: The Sound collector
results.creator_credit: Lynn Smith, David Verrall, Ishu Patel and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The Sound Collector, an animation film that uses a combination of collage, paper cut-outs and colored inks on glass, features Leonard, a six-year-old with an unusual hobby. He collects sounds. Transforming household noises around him into exciting fantasies, he creates an adventure story for his scornful older brother in which knights in armor chase away monsters and perform other daring deeds. This film that will entertain young and old alike lends itself to a variety of classroom uses, to encourage creativity in children, and to stimulate discussion on topics such as individuality, family relationships, and imagination.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lynn Smith, David Verrall, Ishu Patel and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: For the love of a horse
results.brief_description: Follows the training and competition events of a 13 year-old girl and her horse as they prepare for equestrian trials. The girl’s trainer is Jim Elder, Canada’s Olympic gold medal winner, who explains the correct and incorrect procedures for equestrian riding. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Go for gold
results.creator_credit: Dick Durrance, Tom Hubbard and Crystal Productions
results.brief_description: An instructional film for the recreational racer. Former US Olympic coach Bob Beattie explains basic ski-racing techniques as pro-racers demonstrate ski preparation, the start, running the gates, and the finish. Accentuates key points in racing as pro-racers and top recreational skiers run the National Standard Race: NASTAR. Suitable for secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Skinny skiing
results.creator_credit: Bill Snyder, Len Aitken and Oak Creek Films
results.brief_description: Presents a group of cross-country skiers talking about the sport, telling how it is a way of life for them rather than a pastime. Shows them skiing in various settings. Also depicts the correct way to build and occupy a snow cave, and contrasts equipment - skis circa 1900 versus today’s efficient, low-cost skinny skis. Suitable for middle and upper secondary and teacher/tertiary levels.

results.title: Nicky: one of my best friends
results.creator_credit: Anthony Jones, Grania Gurievitch, McGraw-Hill Films and Togg Films
results.brief_description: Nicky is a blind boy who also suffers from cerebral palsy. This film shows him at home with his family and at school with his friends. Nicky attends a normal school because his parents feel that he would benefit more by being in the mainstream.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anthony Jones, Grania Gurievitch, McGraw-Hill Films and Togg Films

results.title: The Ecology of agriculture
results.creator_credit: Agricultural Council of Denmark and Naturfoto
results.brief_description: Aims to promote the use of various agricultural methods which emphasise the scientific approach. Notes the importance of nutrients in the soil: the damage caused by mildew and pests; the need for the use of sprays; the damage caused by excessive spraying; and the development of strains of pests resistant to sprays.
